1.text: WHAT advantage then hath the Jew, or what is the profit of circumcision?

2.text: Much every way. First indeed, because the words of God were committed to them.

3.text: For what if some of them have not believed? shall their unbelief make the faith of God without effect? God forbid.

4.text: But God is true; and every man a liar, as it is written, That thou mayest be justified in thy words, and mayest overcome when thou art judged.

5.text: But if our injustice commend the justice of God, what shall we say? Is God unjust, who executeth wrath?

6.text: (I speak according to man.) God forbid: otherwise how shall God judge this world?

7.text: For if the truth of God hath more abounded through my lie, unto his glory, why am I also yet judged as a sinner?

8.text: And not rather (as we are slandered, and as some affirm that we say) let us do evil, that there may come good? whose damnation is just.

9.text: What then? Do we excel them? No, not so. For we have charged both Jews, and Greeks, that they are all under sin.

10.text: As it is written: There is not any man just.

11.text: There is none that understandeth, there is none that seeketh after God.

12.text: All have turned out of the way; they are become unprofitable together: there is none that doth good, there is not so much as one.

13.text: Their throat is an open sepulchre; with their tongues they have dealt deceitfully. The venom of asps is under their lips.

14.text: Whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness:

15.text: Their feet swift to shed blood:

16.text: Destruction and misery in their ways:

17.text: And the way of peace they have not known:

18.text: There is no fear of God before their eyes.

19.text: Now we know, that what things soever the law speaketh, it speaketh to them that are in the law; that every mouth may be stopped, and all the world may be made subject to God.

20.text: Because by the works of the law no flesh shall be justified before him. For by the law is the knowledge of sin.

21.text: But now without the law the justice of God is made manifest, being witnessed by the law and the prophets.

22.text: Even the justice of God, by faith of Jesus Christ, unto all and upon all them that believe in him: for there is no distinction:

23.text: For all have sinned, and do need the glory of God.

24.text: Being justified freely by his grace, through the redemption, that is in Christ Jesus,

25.text: Whom God hath proposed to be a propitiation, through faith in his blood, to the shewing of his justice, for the remission of former sins,

26.text: Through the forbearance of God, for the shewing of his justice in this time; that he himself may be just, and the justifier of him, who is of the faith of Jesus Christ.

27.text: Where is then thy boasting? It is excluded. By what law? Of works? No, but by the law of faith.

28.text: For we account a man to be justified by faith, without the works of the law.

29.text: Is he the God of the Jews only? Is he not also of the Gentiles? Yes, of the Gentiles also.

30.text: For it is one God, that justifieth circumcision by faith, and uncircumcision through faith.

31.text: Do we, then, destroy the law through faith? God forbid: but we establish the law.
